conclusion: Analyze the relationship between the reciprocal of velocity and displacement from the diagram.
The graph shows 1/v on the y-axis and x on the x-axis; it is a straight line with a positive slope.
A positive slope indicates that as x increases, 1/v also increases.
As the particle moves further, the reciprocal of its velocity increases.
If 1/v increases, then v (velocity) must decrease because the reciprocal of a larger number is smaller.
Since the velocity v is decreasing as the particle moves further, the particle is experiencing a decrease in speed.
A decrease in speed means the particle is decelerating.
